subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 6 Now I know that the Lord rescues his anointed king. He will answer him from his holy heaven and rescue him by his great power. 7 Some nations boast of their chariots and horses, but we boast in the name of the Lord our God.
reflection: The number of David's opponents meant nothing as long as he was on the Lord's side. Victory is "not by force nor by strength, but by the Spirit, says the Lord Almighty. Are you on the Lord's side? You may never face an enemy army, but the battles you face every day can be won with the Lord's strength. .
prayer: Dear Lord, you know that I have never faced an enemy army-but I need your strength to win my battles against Satan, the world, and my own flesh. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 20:6-7 (NLT)

6 Now I know that the Lord rescues his anointed king. He will answer him
from his holy heaven and rescue him by his great power.

7 Some nations boast of their chariots and horses, but we boast in the name
of the Lord our God. 

Today's Thoughts:

The number of David's opponents meant nothing as long as he was on the
Lord's side.

Victory is "not by force nor by strength, but by the Spirit, says the Lord
Almighty.



Are you on the Lord's side? You may never face an enemy army, but the
battles you

face every day can be won with the Lord's strength. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, you know that I have never faced an enemy army-but I need your
strength

to win my battles against Satan, the world, and my own flesh. Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

If anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation;

The old has gone, the new has come. (2 Cor. 5:17) NIV

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 8 Those nations will fall down and collapse, but we will rise up and stand firm. 9 Give victory to our king, O Lord! Answer our cry for help.
reflection: No nation will stand that puts their total trust in their military. The Lord alone is able to hear and save. By a Carpenter mankind was made, and only by that Carpenter can mankind be remade.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that You would increase in me a faith, a hope, and a trust in Your grace and mercy. Forgive me for following anyone or anything else. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 20:8-9

8 Those nations will fall down and collapse, but we will rise up and stand
firm. 
9 Give victory to our king, O Lord! Answer our cry for help.

Today's Thoughts:

No nation will stand that puts their total trust in their military.

The Lord alone is able to hear and save. .



By a Carpenter mankind was made, and only by that Carpenter

can mankind be remade. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, I pray that You would increase in me a faith, a hope, and a trust

in Your grace and mercy. Forgive me for following anyone or anything else. .
. Amen. 



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

"Fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom." Pro. 1:7

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 1 How the king rejoices in your strength, O Lord! He shouts with joy because You give him victory. 6 You have endowed him with eternal blessings and given him the joy of Your presence.
reflection: In vs. 1-6 David described all that he had as gifts from God: his heart's desiresuccess and prosperity-a crown of fine gold-long life-splendor and majestyeternal blessing-and joy. We, too, must look upon all that we have-position-family-wealth-talentas a gift from God. Only then will we use them to give glory back to Him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me remember every day is a gift from You and all that I have is only possible because You sustain me down to the air that I breathe. Help me to use the gifts I have received to give glory to You. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 21:1, 6

1 How the king rejoices in your strength, O Lord! He shouts with joy because
You give him victory. 

6 You have endowed him with eternal blessings and given him the joy of Your
presence.

Today's Thoughts:

In vs. 1-6 David described all that he had as gifts from God: his heart's
desiresuccess and prosperity-a crown of fine gold-long life-splendor and majestyeternal blessing-and joy. 

We, too, must look upon all that we have-position-family-wealth-talentas a gift from God. Only then will we use them to give glory back to Him.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me remember every day is a gift from You and

all that I have is only possible because You sustain me down to the air that

I breathe. Help me to use the gifts I have received to give glory to You. .
. Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

There is no one righteous, not even one. Ro. 3:10



The Christian church is not a congregation of righteous people. 

It is a society of those who know they are not good.

(Dwight E. Stevenson)

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 7 For the king trusts in the Lord. The unfailing love of the Most High will keep him from stumbling.
reflection: Because David trusted in God-God would not let him stumble (be removed from his throne). When we trust in God we have permanence and stability. We may lose a great deal such as, families-jobs-material possessions-but we cannot be shaken from God's favor. He will be our foundation our solid rock-He will never leave or desert us. .
prayer: I thank You, O Lord, that I have a solid foundation in You. I thank You, for Your loving favor, that was proven by Your Son taking my place on the cross and paying the penalty in full for my sins. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 21:7 (NLT)

7 For the king trusts in the Lord. The unfailing love of the Most High will
keep him from stumbling. 

Today's Thoughts:

Because David trusted in God-God would not let him stumble (be removed from
his throne).

When we trust in God we have permanence and stability. We may lose a great
deal such as,

families-jobs-material possessions-but we cannot be shaken from God's favor.



He will be our foundation our solid rock-He will never leave or desert us. .
.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

I thank You, O Lord, that I have a solid foundation in You.

I thank You, for Your loving favor, that was proven by

Your Son taking my place on the cross and paying the 

penalty in full for my sins. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Choose for yourselves this day whom you will serve. (Jos. 24:15 NIV)

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 11 Although they plot against you, their evil schemes will never succeed. 12 For they will turn and run when they see your arrows aimed at them.
reflection: When you see people succeeding with evil acts, remember they will not succeed forever. Their power is only temporary, and God's very presence can send them scattering in a moment. God, according to His plan and purpose, will intervene for His people and give the wicked the judgment they deserve. We should not be dismayed when we see the temporary advantage God's enemies seem to have.
prayer: Dear Lord, Help me to always have You at the center of my life so that I may acquire Godly wisdom which is the best strength I can have. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 21:11-12 (NLT)

11 Although they plot against you, their evil schemes will never succeed.

12 For they will turn and run when they see your arrows aimed at them. 

Today's Thoughts:

When you see people succeeding with evil acts, remember they will not
succeed forever.

Their power is only temporary, and God's very presence can send them
scattering in a 

moment. God, according to His plan and purpose, will intervene for His
people and give 

the wicked the judgment they deserve. 



We should not be dismayed when we see the temporary advantage God's enemies
seem to have.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, Help me to always have You at the center of my life so that I may


acquire Godly wisdom which is the best strength I can have. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Unless you change and become like little childern,

You will never enter the Kingom of heaven. Mat. 18:3 NIV



I have never seen any stronger faith than what I have seen in a child.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 1 My God, my God, why have you abandoned me? Why are you so far away when I groan for help?
reflection: David gave an accurate description of the suffering the Messiah would endure hundreds of years later. David was obviously suffering some great trial, but through his suffering, he like the Messiah to come gained victory. The cry of the Messiah was not a cry of doubt, but an urgent appeal to God.
prayer: O Lord, great is Thy faithfulness unto me, help me to stand steadfast in Your loving kindness with no doubts in my mind. Forgive me for any questions that may come to mind when Your answers are slow in coming. Amen
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 22:1 (NLT)

1 My God, my God, why have you abandoned me? 

Why are you so far away when I groan for help? 

Today's Thoughts:

David gave an accurate description of the suffering the Messiah would endure

hundreds of years later. David was obviously suffering some great trial, but

through his suffering, he like the Messiah to come gained victory.

The cry of the Messiah was not a cry of doubt, but an urgent appeal to God.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, great is Thy faithfulness unto me, help me to stand steadfast in

Your loving kindness with no doubts in my mind. Forgive me for any

questions that may come to mind when Your answers are slow in coming. .
Amen 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

May my meditations be pleasing to him, as I rejoice in the Lord. Ps. 104
:34

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 4 Our ancestors trusted in you, and you rescued them. 5 They cried out to you and were saved. They trusted in you and were never disgraced. 6 But I am a worm and not a man. I am scorned and despised by all!
reflection: When others despise us and belittle us, they treat us as if we were less than human. After being degraded we may become like David, and feel like worms and possibly Feel like maybe they are right-maybe I am no good. When we feel the sting of rejection we need to keep in mind the hope and victory that God promises us. Yes He has said, "I will never leave you or forsake you. " That to us should be enough. .
prayer: O Lord, when I feel down and out, remind me that You are there for me. Remind me again of the love You have for us all and that this life is not all that there is. Remind me again of that wonderful day when I will arrive at the place You promised with no more pain or suffering-where love reigns supreme. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 22:4-6 (NLT)

4 Our ancestors trusted in you, and you rescued them.

5 They cried out to you and were saved. They trusted in you and were never
disgraced. 
6 But I am a worm and not a man. I am scorned and despised by all! 

Today's Thoughts:

When others despise us and belittle us, they treat us as if we were less
than human.

After being degraded we may become like David, and feel like worms and
possibly

Feel like maybe they are right-maybe I am no good.



When we feel the sting of rejection we need to keep in mind the hope and
victory

that God promises us. Yes He has said, "I will never leave you or forsake
you."

That to us should be enough. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, when I feel down and out, remind me that You are there for me.

Remind me again of the love You have for us all and that this life is not 

all that there is. Remind me again of that wonderful day when I will arrive 

at the place You promised with no more pain or suffering-where love 

reigns supreme. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You brought me safely from my mother's womb and led me to trust you at my mother's breast. 10 I was thrust into your arms at my birth. You have been my God from the moment I was born. 11 Do not stay so far from me, for trouble is near, and no one else can help me.
reflection: Be assured that God's loving concern does not begin on the Day we are born and end on the day we die. It reaches back to the days before we were born and reaches ahead along the unending path of eternity. Really our only sure help comes from a God whose concern for us reaches beyond our earthly existence. How can anyone reject such love. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, where could I go while seeking a refuge for my soul? Needing a friend to help me to the end-where could I go but to You O Lord. Yes only in You can I find comfort for my soul. Thank You Lord, for this blessed assurance. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 22:9-11 (NLT)

You brought me safely from my mother's womb and led me to trust you at my
mother's breast.

10 I was thrust into your arms at my birth. You have been my God from the
moment I was born. 
11 Do not stay so far from me, for trouble is near, and no one else can help
me. 

Today's Thoughts:

Be assured that God's loving concern does not begin on the Day we are born
and end on the day we die.

It reaches back to the days before we were born and reaches ahead along the
unending path of eternity.

Really our only sure help comes from a God whose concern for us reaches
beyond our earthly existence.



How can anyone reject such love. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, where could I go while seeking a refuge for my soul?

Needing a friend to help me to the end-where could I go but to You O Lord.

Yes only in You can I find comfort for my soul. Thank You Lord, for this

blessed assurance. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 21 Snatch me from the lion's jaws and from the horns of these wild oxen. 22 I will proclaim your name to my brothers and sisters. I will praise you among your assembled people.
reflection: We see here that David promises to praise God among the people because his private deliverance deserved a public testimony. At times we may go through trials not because we want to sufferBUT because we want to obey God's will. Let the example of Jesus' obedience sustain and encourage you in times of trial. You will be able to face anything if you know that Jesus is with you. Let us always be prepared to offer public praise for His care for us.
prayer: O Lord, our Savior and comforter, in You I can stand against the trials of life because I know You are with me. May Your Spirit guide me in coming before You in reverent submission, willing to do whatever God wants. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 22:21-22

21 Snatch me from the lion's jaws and from the horns of these wild oxen. 
22 I will proclaim your name to my brothers and sisters. I will praise you
among your assembled people. 

Today's Thoughts:

We see here that David promises to praise God among the people because his
private deliverance 

deserved a public testimony. At times we may go through trials not because
we want to sufferBUT because we want to obey God's will. 

Let the example of Jesus' obedience sustain and encourage you in times of
trial. You will be able 

to face anything if you know that Jesus is with you. Let us always be
prepared to offer public 

praise for His care for us.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, our Savior and comforter, in You I can stand against the trials of
life because I know 

You are with me. May Your Spirit guide me in coming before You in reverent
submission, 

willing to do whatever God wants. Amen. 



Pastor AL & Marcie Sather

I Cor. 3:20 The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are
worthless.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 30 Our children will also serve him. Future generations will hear about the wonders of the Lord 31 His righteous acts will be told to those not yet born. They will hear about everything he has done.
reflection: We need to remember that unborn generations are depending upon our faithfulness today. As we teach our children about the Lord, so they will teach their children and their children's children. If we fail to tell our children about the Lord, we may well be breaking the chain of God's influence in generations to come. We must view our children and all young people we meet as God's future leaders. If we want our children to serve the Lord, they must hear about Him from usIt is not enough to rely on the church or those with more knowledge to provide all their Christian education-We most reinforce the lessons of the Bible in our home. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray again that Your Spirit would be my guide so that I would be faithful in sharing Your word so that generations to come would come to faith in You. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 22:30-31 (NLT) 

30 Our children will also serve him. Future generations will hear about the
wonders of the Lord

31 His righteous acts will be told to those not yet born. They will hear
about everything he has done.

Today's Thoughts:

We need to remember that unborn generations are depending upon our
faithfulness today.

As we teach our children about the Lord, so they will teach their children
and their children's 

children. If we fail to tell our children about the Lord, we may well be
breaking the chain of

God's influence in generations to come. We must view our children and all
young people we

meet as God's future leaders. .



If we want our children to serve the Lord, they must hear about Him from usIt is not enough to rely on the church or those with more knowledge to
provide

all their Christian education-We most reinforce the lessons of the Bible in

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

to faith in You. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

2 May God give you more and more grace and peace as you grow in your
knowledgeof God and Jesus our Lord. 2 Peter 1:2 (NLT)

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
reflection: In describing the Lord as a shepherd, David wrote out of his own experience. Sheep are totally dependent on the shepherd for provision, guidance, and protection. The New Testament call Jesus the "Good Shepherd" (John 10:11). The "Great Shepherd" (Hebrews 13:20). The "Head Shepherd" (I Peter 5:4). As the Lord is the Good Shepherd, so we are His sheep-not frighten, passive animals, but obedient follows, wise enough to follow one who will lead us in the right places and in right ways. This psalm does not focus on animal-like qualities of sheep but on the discipleship qualities of those who will follow-When you recognize the Good Shepherd follow Him. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for being a caring Shepherd and a dependable guide. I thank You for being my one sure hope of eternal life and security. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 23:1 (ESV)

The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.

Today's Thoughts:

In describing the Lord as a shepherd, David wrote out of his own experience.

Sheep are totally dependent on the shepherd for provision, guidance, and
protection.

The New Testament call Jesus the "Good Shepherd" (Jn. 10:11).

The "Great Shepherd" (Heb. 13:20).

The "Head Shepherd" (I Pet. 5:4).



As the Lord is the Good Shepherd, so we are His sheep-not frighten, passive
animals, 

but obedient follows, wise enough to follow one who will lead us in the
right places and 

in right ways. This psalm does not focus on animal-like qualities of sheep
but on the 

discipleship qualities of those who will follow-When you recognize the Good
Shepherd 

follow Him. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for being a caring Shepherd and a
dependable guide.

I thank You for being my one sure hope of eternal life and security. .
Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Stand firm then, with the belt of truth buckeled

Around your waist. Eph. 6:14

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters. 3 He restores my soul. He leads me in paths of righteousness for his name's sake.
reflection: When we allow God, our shepherd, to guide us, we have contentment. When we choose to sin and go our own way, we cannot blame God for the environment we have created for ourselves. Our Shepherd knows the "green meadows" and "peaceful streams" that will restore us. We will reach these places only by flowing Him obediently. Rebelling against the Shepherds leading is actually rebelling against our own best interests. We must remember this the next time we are tempted to go our own way rather than the Shepherds way. .
prayer: Dear Lord, help me remember the next time I decide to go my own waythat You have a better way-forgive me for often choosing another way. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 23:2-3 

He makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters. 

3 He restores my soul. He leads me in paths of righteousness for his name's
sake. 

Today's Thoughts:

When we allow God, our shepherd, to guide us, we have contentment.

When we choose to sin and go our own way, we cannot blame God for 

the environment we have created for ourselves. Our Shepherd knows the 

"green meadows" and "peaceful streams" that will restore us. We will reach 

these places only by flowing Him obediently. Rebelling against the Shepherds


leading is actually rebelling against our own best interests. 



We must remember this the next time we are tempted to go our own way rather 

than the Shepherds way. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, help me remember the next time I decide to go my own waythat You have a better way-forgive me for often choosing another way. .
Amen. 





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

The house of the righteous stands firm. Pro. 12:7 NIV

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
reflection: Death can cast a frightening shadow over us, because we are entirely helpless in its presence. We can struggle with other enemies-pain, suffering, disease, and injury, but strength and courage cannot overcome death-It has the final word. ONLY ONE PERSON-can walk with us through death's dark valley and bring us safely to the other side-to the God of life, our shepherdBecause life is uncertain, we should follow this shepherd who offers us eternal comfort.
prayer: O Lord of all life, let me feel Your Spirit's presence when that dark valley comes. Lead me to the other side where there will be eternal comfort. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 23:4

Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no
evil,

for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.

helpless in

its presence. We can struggle with other enemies-pain, suffering, disease,
and 

injury, but strength and courage cannot overcome death-It has the final
word.



ONLY ONE PERSON-can walk with us through death's dark valley and bring

eternal comfort.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord of all life, let me feel Your Spirit's presence when that dark valley
comes. Lead

me to the other side where there will be eternal comfort. .Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

As in the Master's Spirit you take into your arms the little ones,

His own everlasting arms will encircle them and you.

(James Hamilton)

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 5 You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies; you anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows. 6 Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, and I shall dwell in the house of the Lord forever.
reflection: God offers protection even when the enemies surround us. This is the final scene of this psalmWe see that the believers will dwell with God. God, will be the perfect shepherd and the perfect host who promises to guide and protect us throughout our life and to bring us into His house-where a place has already been prepared for us (John 14:2)
prayer: Dear Lord help me every day to experience the joy of doing things for You. O Lord allow nothing to discourage me nor rob me of the joy which is put into my heart by Your Holy Spirit. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 23:5, 6

head with oil; my cup overflows. 

6 Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, and I
shall dwell in the house of the Lord forever. 

Today's thoughts:

God offers protection even when the enemies surround us. This is the final

shepherd and the perfect host

who promises to guide and protect us throughout our life and to bring us
into His house-where 

a place has already been prepared for us (Jn. 14:2)

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord allow nothing to discourage me nor rob me of the joy which is put 

into my heart by Your Holy Spirit. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-_1

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The earth is the Lord's and the fullness thereof, the world and those who dwell therein, 2 for He has founded it upon the seas and established it upon the rivers. 3 Who shall ascend the hill of the Lord? And who shall stand in His holy place?
reflection: Because "the earth is the Lord's" all of us are stewards or caretakers. We should be committed to the proper management of the world and its resources-BUT we are not to become devoted to anything created or act as the sole proprietors-because this world will pass away (I John 2:17) Verse one sure shots a hole in the old saying of some-" I'm a self-made Man. " All that we possess is a gift from God, He is the one who has given us strength to get up and do our thing-He has given us the resources to put together the things we enjoy. .
prayer: O Lord, as I think about all that exists and that everything came about by Your creation, I feel so small and yet You invite us to come before You with our requests. My request today is that Your Holy Spirit would comfort all who are in need of comfort. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 24:1-3
The earth is the Lord's and the fullness thereof, the world and those who
dwell therein, 
2 for He has founded it upon the seas and established it upon the rivers. 
3 Who shall ascend the hill of the Lord? And who shall stand in His holy
place? 
Today's Thoughts:
Because "the earth is the Lord's" all of us are stewards or caretakers.
We should be committed to the proper management of the world and 
its resources-BUT we are not to become devoted to anything created 
or act as the sole proprietors-because this world will pass away (I Jn.
2:17)

Verse one sure shots a hole in the old saying of some-" I'm a self-made
Man."
All that we possess is a gift from God, He is the one who has given us
strength
to get up and do our thing-He has given us the resources to put together the

things we enjoy. .
Today's Prayer Suggestion:
O Lord, as I think about all that exists and that everything came about by
Your creation, I feel so small and yet You invite us to come before You with

our requests. My request today is that Your Holy Spirit would comfort all
who are in need of comfort. Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather
Carry each others burdens, and in this way you 
will fulfill the Law of Christ. Gal. 6:2 NIV

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who does not lift up his soul to what is false and does not swear deceitfully. 5 He will receive blessing from the Lord and righteousness from the God of his salvation. 6 Such is the generation of those who seek Him, who seek the face of the God of Jacob.
reflection: Vs. 4 refers to all lies, especially those told under oath. God truly values honesty. Dishonesty come easily, especially when complete truthfulness could cost us something, make us uncomfortable, or put us is an unfavorable light. Dishonest communication hinders relationships. Without honesty, a relationship with God is impossible. If we lie to others, we will begin to deceive ourselves. God cannot hear us or speak to us if we are building a wall of deception. God has set before us a choice-either a curse or a blessing. It is amazing how so many through their disobedience have chosen the curse. YES we have a choice to make-what will it be a blessing or a curse. We can live for ourselves OR live in service to God. To choose our own way-is to live on a deadened road, but to choose God's way is to receive eternal life (John 5:24).
prayer: O Lord, how good and faithful You are in spite of my sinfulness and unfaithfulness. As Your baptized child, I return to You for forgiveness and for renewed zeal to do Your will; in Jesus name. Amen.
original_content:

He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who does not lift up his soul to
what is false and does not swear deceitfully.

5 He will receive blessing from the Lord and righteousness from the God of
his salvation. 

6 Such is the generation of those who seek Him, who seek the face of the God
of Jacob. 

Today's Thoughts:

Vs. 4 refers to all lies, especially those told under oath. God truly values
honesty.

Dishonesty come easily, especially when complete truthfulness could cost us
something, 

make us uncomfortable, or put us is an unfavorable light. Dishonest
communication 

hinders relationships. Without honesty, a relationship with God is
impossible. If we lie 

to others, we will begin to deceive ourselves. 

God cannot hear us or speak to us if we are building a wall of deception. .
.



God has set before us a choice-either a curse or a blessing. It is amazing
how so many 

through their disobedience have chosen the curse. YES we have a choice to
make-what 

will it be a blessing or a curse. 

We can live for ourselves OR live in service to God. To choose our own
way-is to live 

on a dead-end road, but to choose God's way is to receive eternal life (Jn.
5:24). 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, how good and faithful You are in spite of my sinfulness and
unfaithfulness.

As Your baptized child, I return to You for forgiveness and for renewed zeal
to do

Your will; in Jesus name. Amen. 



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

I will thank the Lord because He is just;

I will sing praises to the name of the Lord Most High.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 7 Lift up your heads, O gates! And be lifted up, O ancient doors, that the King of glory may come in. 8 Who is this King of glory? The Lord, strong and mighty, the Lord, mighty in battle! 9 Lift up your heads, O gates! And lift them up, O ancient doors, that the King of glory may come in. 10 Who is this King of glory? The Lord of hosts, he is the King of glory!
reflection: The question was, "Who is the King of glory?" Of course He is identified as the Lord AlmightyThe Messiah Himself. This phrase was often used in the temple-outside the temple the people would resound with the answer, "He is the Lord Almighty. " This was an important lesson to the children who were participating. It is a lesson we should all learn well - YES the King of Glory, is the Lord of hosts. Matt 21:5 (ESV) "Say to the daughter of Zion, 'Behold, your king is coming to you, humble, and mounted on a donkey, and on a colt, the foal of a beast of burden. ' " When Jesus entered Jerusalem on the donkey He affirmed His Messianic royalty as well as His humility.
prayer: Dear Lord of grace and mercy draw near to your people wherever they are, and help them through their trials and troubles. Forgive us all of our many sins through the cleansing power of Your precious blood. Grant us the strength to live victorious every day. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 24: 7-10

7 Lift up your heads, O gates! And be lifted up, O ancient doors, that the
King of glory may come in. 

8 Who is this King of glory? The Lord, strong and mighty, the Lord, mighty
in battle! 

9 Lift up your heads, O gates! And lift them up, O ancient doors, that the
King of glory may come in. 

10 Who is this King of glory? The Lord of hosts, he is the King of glory! 

Today's Thoughts:

The question was, "Who is the King of glory?" Of course He is identified as
the Lord AlmightyThe Messiah Himself. This phrase was often used in the temple-outside the
temple the people 

would resound with the answer, "He is the Lord Almighty." This was an
important lesson to the 

children who were participatingIt is a lesson we should all learn well-YES the King of Glory, is the Lord
of hosts. Matt 21:5 (ESV)

"Say to the daughter of Zion, 'Behold, your king is coming to you, humble,
and mounted 

on a donkey, and on a colt, the foal of a beast of burden.' " 



When Jesus entered Jerusalem on the donkey He affirmed His Messianic royalty
as well as His humility.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord of grace and mercy draw near to your people wherever they are, 

and help them through their trials and troubles. Forgive us all of our many 

sins through the cleansing power of Your precious blood. Grant us the
strength 

to live victorious every day. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

My mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips Ps. 63:5

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: To you, O Lord, I lift up my soul. 2 O my God, in you I trust; let me not be put to shame; let not my enemies exult over me.
reflection: Seventy-two Psalm-almost half the book-speak about enemies. Enemies are those who oppose not only us, but also God's way of living. Give this some thought-we can view temptations-money-successprestige-lust-as our enemies. Of course Satan is our greatest enemy David asked God to keep his enemies from overcoming him because they opposed what God stood for. If his enemies succeeded, David feared that many would think that trusting God was futile. We too should not want our enemies' success to be an obstacle to the faith of others.
prayer: O Lord, I am aware of the fact that I have many of these enemies-I pray that I would be sensitive to Your Spirit's guidance so that my enemies would not triumph over me. In Jesus name, Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 25:1-2

To you, O Lord, I lift up my soul. 2 O my God, in you I trust;

let me not be put to shame; let not my enemies exult over me.

Today's Thoughts:

Seventy-two Psalm-almost half the book-speak about enemies.

Enemies are those who oppose not only us, but also God's way of living.

Give this some thought-we can view temptations-money-successprestige-lust-as our enemies. Of course Satan is our greatest enemy



David asked God to keep his enemies from overcoming him because they 

opposed what God stood for. If his enemies succeeded, David feared that 

many would think that trusting God was futile.



We too should not want our enemies' success to be an obstacle to the faith
of others.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, I am aware of the fact that I have many of these enemies-I pray that


I would be sensitive to Your Spirit's guidance so that my enemies would not 

triumph over me. In Jesus name, Amen. 



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.

Phil. 4:8

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Indeed, none who wait for you shall be put to shame; they shall be ashamed who are wantonly treacherous. 4 Make me to know your ways, O Lord; teach me your paths.
reflection: David wanted God's guidance-but how do we receive God's guidance? WELL the very first step is to want to be guided and to realize that God's primary guidance system is in His Word, the Bible Psalm 119 tells of the endless knowledge found in God's Word. By reading it and constantly learning from it, we will gain the wisdom to understand God's direction for our lives. We may be tempted to demand answers from God, but David asked for direction. When we are willing to seek God, learn from His Word, and obey His commands, then we will receive His specific guidance.
prayer: Dear Lord, my prayer is that of David, "Make me know Your Ways-teach me Your paths. " In Jesus Name. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 25:3-4

Indeed, none who wait for you shall be put to shame; they shall be ashamed
who are wantonly treacherous.

4 Make me to know your ways, O Lord; teach me your paths. 

Today's Thoughts:

David wanted God's guidance-but how do we receive God's guidance? WELL the
very first step 

is to want to be guided and to realize that God's primary guidance system is
in His Word, the Bible 

Ps. 119 tells of the endless knowledge found in God's Word. .



By reading it and constantly learning from it, we will gain the wisdom to
understand God's direction 

for our lives. We may be tempted to demand answers from God, but David asked
for direction. 

When we are willing to seek God, learn from His Word, and obey His commands,
then we will receive 

His specific guidance. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, my prayer is that of David, "Make me know Your Ways-teach me Your
paths."

In Jesus Name. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

In His great mercy He has given us new birth into a living hope.

Pet. 1:3 NIV



Optimism is the faith that leads to achievment.

Nothing can be done without hope.

(Helen Keller)

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Good and upright is the Lord; therefore he instructs sinners in the way. 9 He leads the humble in what is right, and teaches the humble his way. 10 All the paths of the Lord are steadfast love and faithfulness, for those who keep his covenant and his testimonies. 11 For your name's sake, O Lord, pardon my guilt, for it is great.
reflection: How much thought do we put into the fact that we are bombarded every day with relentless appeals to go in various directions? TV advertising alone places hundreds of options before us, in addition to appeals from political partiescults-false religions and dozens of other groups. Numerous organizations, including Christian organizations, seek to motivate us to support a cause. Add to that dozens of decisions we must make concerning our job, our family, our money, and our society, and we become desperate for someone to show us the right way-If you find yourself pulled in several directions, remember that God teaches the humble way, His way. .
prayer: Dear Lord, when I am pulled in several directions each day help to remember to ask myself-What Would Jesus Do-WWJD. So that the truth of Christ would be in me. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 25:8-11

Good and upright is the Lord; therefore he instructs sinners in the way. 

9 He leads the humble in what is right, and teaches the humble his way. 

10 All the paths of the Lord are steadfast love and faithfulness, 

for those who keep his covenant and his testimonies. 

11 For your name's sake, O Lord, pardon my guilt, for it is great. 

Today's Thought:

How much thought do we put into the fact that we are bombarded every day 

with relentless appeals to go in various directions? TV advertising alone
places 

hundreds of options before us, in addition to appeals from political
partiescults-false religions and dozens of other groups. 

Numerous organizations, including Christian organizations, seek to motivate
us 

to support a cause. Add to that dozens of decisions we must make concerning 

our job, our family, our money, and our society, and we become desperate for


someone to show us the right way-If you find yourself pulled in several
directions, 

remember that God teaches the humble way, His way. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, when I am pulled in several directions each day help to remember 

to ask myself-What Would Jesus Do-WWJD. So that the truth of Christ 

would be in me. Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 12 Who is the man who fears the Lord? Him will he instruct in the way that he should choose. 13 His soul shall abide in well-being, and his offspring shall inherit the land.
reflection: To fear the Lord is to recognize God's attributes. He is holy-almighty-righteous-pureall knowing-all powerful-and all wise. When we regard God correctly, we gain a clearer picture of ourselves, sinful-weak-frail-and needy. When we recognize who God is and who we are-we will fall at His feet in humble respect. Only then will He show us His way. .
prayer: O Lord, forgive me for not always having a clear view of who You really are. Help me to always come before You in humble respect. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 25: 12-13

12 Who is the man who fears the Lord? Him will he instruct in the way that
he should choose. 

13 His soul shall abide in well-being, and his offspring shall inherit the
land. 

Today's thoughts:

To fear the Lord is to recognize God's attributes. He is
holy-almighty-righteous-pureall knowing-all powerful-and all wise. When we regard God correctly, we gain
a clearer 

picture of ourselves, sinful-weak-frail-and needy.

When we recognize who God is and who we are-we will fall at His feet in
humble respect.

Only then will He show us His way. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, forgive me for not always having a clear view of who You really are.

Help me to always come before You in humble respect. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

By God's trials, He means to purify us-and to bring 

us into implicit humble trust in Himself.

(Horace Bushnell)

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Lord advises those who fear him. He reveals to them the intent of his promise. 15 My eyes are always on the Lord. He removes my feet from traps.
reflection: "Friendship with the Lord is reserved for those who fear Him. " God offers intimate and lasting friendship to those who revere Him, who hold Him in highest honor. What relationship could ever compare with having the Lord of all creation for a friend? Your everlasting friendship will grow as you revere Him.
prayer: O Lord, I pray that I would always be sensitive to Your Spirit's advice so that I might receive the intent of Your promises. Guide my feet so that I would not fall into the traps of this world. Amen.

for a friend?

Your everlasting friendship will grow as you revere Him. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

that

fall into the traps of this world. Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Under the shadow of earthly disappointment, all 

unconscious to ourselves, our Divine Redeemer 

is walking by our side. (E. H. Chapin)

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 16 Turn to me, and have pity on me. I am lonely and oppressed. 17 Relieve my troubled heart, and bring me out of my distress. 18 Look at my misery and suffering, and forgive all my sins.
reflection: Do life's problems seem to go from bad to worse? God is the only one who can reverse this downward spiral. He can take our problems and turn them into glorious victories. BUT there is one necessary requirement-we like David, must cry out, "Turn to me and have mercy on me. " When you are willing to do that, God can turn the worst into something wonderful. The next step is yours-God has already made His offer. .
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, thank You for being my one and onlyall-sufficient Savior. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 25:16-18

"Turn to me and have mercy on me." When you are willing to do that, 

God can turn the worst into something wonderful.



The next step is yours-God has already made His offer. .

Dear Lord Jesus, thank You for being my one and onlyall-sufficient Savior. Amen.

(the Lord's promise) I will be with you always-(Mt. 28:20)

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 19 See how my enemies have increased in number, how they have hated me with vicious hatred! 20 Protect my life, and rescue me! Do not let me be put to shame. I have taken refuge in You. 21 May integrity and honesty protect me, for I put my hope in You.
reflection: If ever two powerful forces were needed to preserve us along life's way, they are integrity and honesty. The psalmist asks for these to protect him step by step. Honesty makes us learn God's requirements and strive to fulfill them. Integrity-being what we say we are-keeps us from claiming to be honest while living as if we do not know God. Honesty-says, "This is the Shepherds way. " And integrity-says, "I will walk consistently in it. " Are you walking consistently in the Shepherds way?
prayer: Dear Lord, in my weakness and with my sins, help me hear Your loving voice calling me. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 25:19-21

19 See how my enemies have increased in number, how they have hated me with
vicious hatred! 

20 Protect my life, and rescue me! Do not let me be put to shame. I have
taken refuge in You. 

21 May integrity and honesty protect me, for I put my hope in You.

Today's Thoughts:

If ever two powerful forces were needed to preserve us along life's way, 

they are integrity and honesty. The psalmist asks for these to protect him 

step by step. Honesty makes us learn God's requirements and strive to 

fulfill them. Integrity-being what we say we are-keeps us from claiming 

to be honest while living as if we do not know God. .



Honesty-says, "This is the Shepherds way." 

And integrity-says, "I will walk consistently in it."

Are you walking consistently in the Shepherds way?



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, in my weakness and with my sins, help me hear 

Your loving voice calling me. .Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

We rejoice in our sufferings, becausse we know that suffering produces 

perseverance; preseverance, character, and character, hope. Ro. 5:3

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 1 Vindicate me, O Lord, for I have walked in my integrity, and I have trusted in the Lord without wavering. 2 Prove me, O Lord, and try me; test my heart and my mind. 3 For your steadfast love is before my eyes, and I walk in your faithfulness.
reflection: When David said, he had walked in integrity, he was not claiming to be sinless-that is impossible for any human being. BUT he was consistently in fellowship with Godclearing his record when he sinned by asking for forgiveness. Here he pleads with God to clear his name of false charges made against him by his enemies. We too can ask God to examine us, trusting Him to forgive our sins and clear our record according to His mercy. .
prayer: Thank You Lord, for the love that forgives me. Help me treasure it even though I cannot understand it. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 26:1-3

1 Vindicate me, O Lord, for I have walked in my integrity, and I have
trusted in the Lord without wavering. 

2 Prove me, O Lord, and try me; test my heart and my mind. 

3 For your steadfast love is before my eyes, and I walk in your
faithfulness. 

Today's Thought:

When David said, he had walked in integrity, he was not claiming to be
sinless-that is 

impossible for any human being. BUT he was consistently in fellowship with
Godclearing his record when he sinned by asking for forgiveness. Here he pleads
with God 

to clear his name of false charges made against him by his enemies. .

We too can ask God to examine us, trusting Him to forgive our sins and clear

according to His mercy. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

even though I cannot understand it. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

In everything give thanks. (I Thess. 5:18)

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 4 I do not sit with men of falsehood, nor do I consort with hypocrites. 5 I hate the assembly of evildoers, and I will not sit with the wicked.
reflection: Should we stay away from unbelievers? No! Although there are-some places Christians should avoid. Jesus demonstrated that we must go out among unbelievers to help them. But remember there is a difference between being with unbelievers and being one of them. Being one of them harms our witness for God. Ask yourself about the people you enjoy. "If I am with them often, will I become less obedient to God in outlook or action?" If the answer is yes, carefully monitor how you spend your time with these people and what effect it has on you. .
prayer: O Lord, bless my sharing of Your powerful Word. Use it to bring dead hearts to life and protect my heart in the process. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 96:4, 5

places 

Christians should avoid. Jesus demonstrated that we must go out among

to help them. But remember there is a difference between being with

being one of them. Being one of them harms our witness for God. 



Ask yourself about the people you enjoy. "If I am with them often, will I
become less

monitor how you 

spend your time with these people and what effect it has on you. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Use it to bring dead hearts to life and protect my

heart in the process. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

The finest test of Character is seen in the amount 

and the power of gratitude we have.

(Milo H. Gates)

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 6 I will wash my hands in innocence. I will walk around your altar, O Lord, 7 so that I may loudly sing a hymn of thanksgiving and tell about all your miracles. 8 O Lord, I love the house where you live, the place where your glory (light) shines.
reflection: God's light represents what is good, pure, true, holy and reliable. Of course darkness represents what is sinful and evil. God alone can guide us out of the darkness of sin. Light is also related to the truth in that light exposes whatever exists, whether it is good or bad. David exclaimed how he loved to worship in the house where the Lord lived. We should worship God with the same love and reverence as David did. .
prayer: Dear Lord, make me a faithful witness to the Savior so that others may walk with me to heaven. Amen

Light is also related to the truth in that light exposes whatever exists,
whether it is 

good or bad. David exclaimed how he loved to worship in the house where the

We should worship God with the same love and reverence as David did.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Simplicity reaches out after God; purity discovers and enjoys Him.

Thomas A Kempis

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 9 Do not sweep away my soul along with hardened sinners or my life along with bloodthirsty people. 10 Evil schemes are in their hands. Their right hands are full of bribes. 11 But I walk with integrity. Rescue me, and have pity on me. 12 My feet stand on level ground. I will praise the Lord with the choirs in worship.
reflection: How often have we complained about our problems to whoever would listenand praise God in private? O how much better it would be if we for us to complain in private and praise God publicly. Let us remember today, from where our blessing flow.
prayer: Dear Lord, keep me awake and watching for my Saviors return so I can follow Him to glory. Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Clothe yourselves with humility toward one another, because, 

God opposes the proud but give grace to the humble. I Pet 5:5

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Always be joyful in the Lord! I'll say it again: Be joyful! Let everyone know how considerate you are. The Lord is near. Never worry about anything. But in every situation let God know what you need in prayers and requests while giving thanks. Then God's peace, which goes beyond anything we can imagine, will guard your thoughts and emotions through Christ Jesus (Philippians 4:4-7)
reflection: Imagine never worrying about anything! It seems like an impossibility all have worries on the job, in our homes, at school. BUT Paul advice's us to turn our worries into prayers. Would you like to worry less? Then pray more! Whenever you start to worry, stop and pray, giving thanks for all that God has done in the past and what He promises to do in the future.
original_content:
Spec. Thanksgiving Verses: Phil 4:4-7 

4 Always be joyful in the Lord! I'll say it again: Be joyful! 

5 Let everyone know how considerate you are. The Lord is near. 

6 Never worry about anything. But in every situation let God know 

what you need in prayers and requests while giving thanks. 

7 Then God's peace, which goes beyond anything we can imagine, 

will guard your thoughts and emotions through Christ Jesus 

Thanksgiving Thought's:

Imagine never worrying about anything! It seems like an impossibilitywe all have worries on the job, in our homes, at school. BUT Paul advices 

us to turn our worries into prayers. Would you like to worry less?

Then pray more! Whenever you start to worry, stop and pray, giving thanks 

for all that God has done in the past and what He promises to do in the
future.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Lord is my light and my salvation. Who is there to fear? The Lord is my life's fortress. Who is there to be afraid of? 2 Evildoers closed in on me to tear me to pieces. My opponents and enemies stumbled and fell. 3 Even though an army sets up camp against me, my heart will not be afraid. Even though a war breaks out against me, I will still have confidence {in the Lord}.
reflection: Fear is a dark shadow that envelopes us and ultimately imprisons us within ourselves. I think that each of us have been a prisoner of fear one time or another-fear of rejection, misunderstanding, uncertainty, sickness, or even death. But we can conquer fear by using the bright liberating light of the Lord, who brings salvation. If we want to dispel the darkness of fear, let us remember the words of the psalmist, "the Lord is my light and my salvation. "
prayer: O Lord, the next time I come into a situation that causes fear, help me remember the wise words of wisdom and encouragement of the psalmist; "The Lord is my light and salvation. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 27:1-3

life's fortress. Who is there to be afraid of?

stumbled and fell.

Even though a war 

breaks out against me, I will still have confidence {in the Lord}.

misunderstanding, uncertainty, sickness, or even death. But we can conquer

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 4 I have asked one thing from the Lord. This I will seek: to remain in the Lord's house all the days of my life in order to gaze at the Lord's beauty and to search for an answer in His temple. 5 He hides me in His shelter when there is trouble. He keeps me hidden in His tent. He sets me high on a rock. 6 Now my head will be raised above my enemies who surround me. I will offer sacrifices with shouts of joy in His tent. I will sing and make music to praise the Lord.
reflection: By the "house of the Lord" and "His Temple, " David could have been referring to the Tabernacle in Gibeon, or to the Temple that his son Solomon was to build-but David may have also used the word Temple to mean "The presence of the Lord. " His greatest wish was to live in God presence each day of his life. Sadly this is not the greatest desire of many who claim to be believers. But those who desire to live in God's presence each day will be able to enjoy that relationship forever. .
prayer: O Lord, I thank You for the help You offer for today and a hope for the future. I pray for an unwavering confidence in You so that I may never fear those dark days that may trouble me. Amen.

in order to gaze at the Lord's beauty and to search for an answer in His

5 He hides me in His shelter when there is trouble. He keeps me hidden in
His tent. He sets me high on a rock. 

6 Now my head will be raised above my enemies who surround me. I will offer
sacrifices with shouts of joy in His tent. 

I will sing and make music to praise the Lord. 

Today's Thoughts:

By the "house of the Lord" and "His Temple," David could have been referring
to the Tabernacle in Gibeon, 

or to the Temple that his son Solomon was to build-but David may have also
used the word Temple to mean 

"The presence of the Lord." His greatest wish was to live in God presence
each day of his life.

Sadly this is not the greatest desire of many who claim to be believers. But
those who desire to live in God's 

presence each day will be able to enjoy that relationship forever. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

future.

I pray for an unwavering confidence in You so that I may never fear those 

dark days that may trouble me. Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

The thoughts of the righteous are right. Pro. 12:5
